description:
I was hungry and didn't want the dry bread and cereal my hotel was offering. I found this around the corner, looked up the menu, and hit it for breakfast.

I had a breakfast bowl. So good. I watched the man in the kitchen fry up my 2 eggs. Then the lady threw them into a bowl and added more toppings. $5.95. The cheapest joint I've been to in SF so far. The order area is chipotle-esq with the way they have their meats and toppings laid out. 

I was here around 10:15 am soon after they opened. I sat and ate and watched the rest of the tourists walk by this gem. It's not fancy from the outside but most hole in the walls aren't.
author: Rania N.

description:
Sometimes you have a craving. On this day I had a craving for some quality Mexican food. Anytime you can find a taqueria you know it's gonna be some quality food. I happened to stumble upon this spot on my foot patrol of union square. 

The menu is easy to read and understand. The place is small and wasn't busy on this Friday afternoon. The gentleman working was by himself, but since it wasn't busy it worked out just fine. He was cleaning up and making sure he had enough of everything out before he helped me. 

I asked for a carne asada burrito w/ rice, guacamole, and salsa. A pretty basic burrito. The man was cleaning up any mess he made as he made my burrito. That speaks volumes IMO. I watched him as he then proceeded to fold my burrito. This guy was an artist. He moved all the ingredients around to get an even amount throughout the burrito. Then he tighten it up as he rolled. This thing was HUGE! 

I came back to my room a few blocks away and began to devour this burrito. OMG! Was this thing good. I ate about half of it and every bite was just as good as the last. I thought I would save the rest for after my nap, but my taste buds said otherwise. 

Will def come back for my burritos here. Gracias!
author: Kevin Z.

description: Stumbled onto this place just down from our hotel and was really pleased with the choice.  Authentic, nice portions and very tasty!  And very reasonably priced.  We will definitely make this a SF tradition!
author: G M A.

description: Cheap and gets the job done. The baby burrito is a good deal.
author: David L.

description:
I'm from LA, so I'm a little snooty when it comes to tacos. El Sol is a reliable join. I typically get my tacos from the Mission District (La Taqueria is my favorite), which has set the bar high. I've been eating tacos street style all my life, so if someone offers me a hardshell taco or puts shredded cheddar cheese instead of cotija or queso blanco on their taco, we have a problem. 

My co-workers are obsessed with this place. Probably because you can get a meal for under $10. I really did not like the burrito bowl. I ate half of the baby bowl and immediately felt bloated and sluggish. I recommend the 3 baby tacos, which are really just street tacos. The breakfast burrito is also amazing! You know a food is good when you catch yourself thinking about it. 

$8 credit card minimum. Pay a little extra for chips and salsa, but it's worth it!
author: Joanna S.

description:
Had a carne Asada burrito & cheese nachos. 
I was starving and other Mexican places were a bit too far...not bad but not the best....
author: Roger S.

description:
I love this place!!! I abso friggin lutely love this place. There is no better Mex. breakfast in the area. Breakfast burritos and bowls are tons of food, staff almost always undercharges and extra scoops of beans or guac are like 50 cents. Never had anything but a great meal here, I come ALL the time for breakfast and lunch in the same day.
Celiac friendly. Will clean down the grill if you ask.
author: David S.

description:
Love u guys so much came here two days in a row say hi to me like family!!!! Super sweet free chips and salsa to go yum love u so so so
Much
author: Rari Z.

description:
El Sol Taqueria is located in a touristy location on Geary just before Jones in the hood (Tenderloin). As it is open till late, I decided to give it a try a couple of days ago. The menu is your standard Mexican dishes like tacos, burritos, nachos, quesadillas, enchiladas and dinner plates. After going through the menu I decided to get the Burrito Mojado ($9.95) to-go. Communication with the two people behind the counter is difficult to say the least so if you want major customizations you are in for a good ride. I think they have undergone special training in Chinatown to show universal contempt towards one and all. For the meat I selected Carne Asada which was dry burnt meat sitting in a container in the steam table.

After putting the burrito together in the to-go container to my shock the gentlemen behind the counter reached into the freezer for a tub of cold salsa. It was taken literally out of the freezer opened and then spooned on to the burrito, which was then tossed into a microwave. Not even a commercial grade microwave, like one of the cheap $50 ones that you have at home. I mean expecting these folks to care, about plastic leaking into food when it is microwaved is a waste, but it is not lost on me. At this point I just wanted this to end and thankfully it did after some sour cream and guacamole were tossed on the microwaved burrito, and I was on my way.

What I got literally looked like roadkill. Microwaving the burrito pulled out the last drop of moisture from the Carne Asada and it felt like chewing on pebbles. The hot salsa made it possible to put this crap down (and being hungry helped). They should be ashamed of putting out such bad food. My search for a decent Taqueria continues. No question of coming back here.
author: Ahmad J.

description: This is So Cal Mexican food. Great polo asada and pinto beans. What a great find away from home. The street taco's are called "Baby Taco's" and they are grown up, filled with meat. Great service and very clean. Thanks for keeping it real!
author: Terry H.

description: Tiny little restaurant, mainly good for take-out. But the burrito was delicious, and the staff was friendly and fast. There are a number of very good Mexican restaurants nearby, but if all you want is take-out this is probably the best one.
author: Carl O.

description: First off, I gotta say that the folks here were great. Super friendly and provided great service. The girlfriend and I was visiting SF and decided to go on a late night food crawl, and decided why not grab some Mexican food. Although I do love the service here, I gotta say that the food fell short of anything too spectacular. Compared to all the other Mexican food spots I've visited, it was nothing too special and didn't quite stand out. We went for the Super Steak Burrito and fish tacos. The pricing was great and service was exceptional.
author: Xue V.

description:
This was one of the first restaurants I came to when I visited SF for the first time. Ironically it didn't quite make an impression at the time; it's quite tasty and better than what I had had in Seattle, and the nachos were enormous. But, it wasn't SO AMAZING as to write home about. I'd like to go back sometime now that I've had a better taste for what the bay has to offer. Convenient location at least, right along Geary and the 38. 

Yeah I know this review is lame, I'm sorry! But I wanted to document this piece of my history and give it due recognition as to being a tasty, good value place to eat.
author: Chris S.

description: I visited from Chicago. I was not disappointed! Really good meat and bean options. I haven't seen that much variety.
author: Sean F.

description:
Had super yummy (and very inexpensive) chorizo breakfast tacos this morning with spicy salsa add sour cream. They only gave each huge Taco one tortilla so it did break, but the flavor was so awesome I just ate it with a fork and forgot all about it. The spicy salsa was spicy because of the fresh chopped jalapeño that tasted so nice and fresh. 

I would take one star taken off because of how the tortilla fell apart, but the place was clean, the food was fast, and it tasted so good I'm going to give 5 stars.
author: Sierra B.

description:
Certain things are a hit or miss. They speak almost 0 english. Even the person who's supposed to help doesn't speak English. This did make it tough to order. 

Good burrito, came back a second time and modified it (no beans) add rice and hot sauce, which made it very good.

Would recommend for a cheap takeout.
author: Grant R.

description:
Average it smoke average quality Mexican food. They are nice people and fast. It's a small place with a few small tables.

3 stars because I almost killed myself on thier rug. It was like stepping on a banana peel. I slid into the door, and then it was crumpled I couldn't open the door.

Also thier trash can is small, difficult to get to, and hard to open the lid and get everything in there with out making a mess.

So watch your step literally, and leave your dirty dishes on the table, if you come here.
author: Brian L.

description: Nice mom and pop joint. Stopped here for a quick holdover meal until we ate dinner later. Got some regular carne asada tacos, came with onion, cilantro and salsa. Tacos were tasty with a hefty amount of meat. Everything tasted authentic and spiced well.
author: Jay H.

description: My friends and I popped in here looking for breakfast burritos while in the area and were pleasantly surprised. The lady working the counter was very nice. We all ordered chorizo breakfast burritos and shared an order of chicken super nachos. Portions are big there. It was wayyyyy too much food for the 3 of us, but we loved every bite. It's small inside, but there are a few tables and chairs. I would say this is a solid neighborhood taqueria.
author: Liz M.

description: i thought this place would be a nice burrito place as good at mission at least but no. meat was cold and everything was cold. it's like Chipotle but worse. I never write bad reviews and this'll be my first and hopefully last  so disappointed. The salsa and chips costs money and you do not get a salsa for burrito.
author: Timothy C.

description: Considering all factors, location, quality of the resulting food, and the nice staff, 4+
author: Darrin C.

description:
Great place for a quick bite to eat! Definitely helps that it's right next to my apartment, doesn't cost an arm and a leg, and stays open late.

Only negative is that if you order nachos towards the end of the day, they might be a tiny bit stale.

A solid 4 stars for me!
author: Aleksandr A.

description: Typical Mexican taqueria and just what I expected. Delicious build your own burritos or tacos. My wife and I frequently eat from hole in walls and taco trucks. The price was right on and the flavor was right on. Will definitely return to this Taqueria.
author: Fred R.

description:
Good food.  Terrible customer service.  
That cashier chick needs to be fired!  Very disrespectful to the customers.
author: Alex R.

description: Got the baby burrito- chicken with black beans. It was an amazingly stuffed and rolled burrito where I had every ingredient in each bite! Wanted to take pictures but I inhaled it. Salsa was fresh, guacamole  and sour cream really added to the deliciousness of the burrito. Don't know what meats they have- looks like chicken and pork and a then I'm not sure because it's not listed anywhere.
author: Alex U.

description: The staff was super nice and very helpful. Unfortunately the food was not that great. The servings were great, but the meat tasted smoky, almost burnt. It ruined the tacos for me.
author: Amanda M.

description:
4.5 stars 

This place is delicious with a good selection of meats. They have huge burritos and yummy crisp quesadillas. The one thing that threw me off just a  bit was when they use the microwave to melt cheese onto the entrees. That being said, they move really fast. The people who work they are very nice. They keep the crowds moving, happy and filled with yummy food. 

Some of my faves -- their shrimp quesadilla, anything with their green chile pork, breakfast burritos and their baby burritos.
author: Vijay A.

description:
The stomach started rumbling, so it was time to find some eats. And Teresa (my stomach) was craving a burrito!!! After a certain hour, the kitchen at home is closed, so it's always good to have a fallback option. And this is definitely my go-to burrito place, and not just because it's close. They are dependable with their service and quality of food. This place is definitely a cubic zirconium in the rough, and I love it! Cheaper than most burrito places in the Mission, and just as good quality, if not better. Great place to go and grab a quick bite at any time of the day (yes, they serve breakfast!!)

So about that burrito: it's just the right amount rice to beans to salsa and other accoutrements. And the queso (aka cheese)!! Just absolutely deliciousness. Oh, and they have this special red sauce that they squeeze over my shrimp that is just delish!!! I don't dream about these burritos, but it's the first place that comes to mind when I need to grab something quick to eat, or just want a big, fat burrito!

If you're in town near Union Square and have a hankering for a taco, burrito, or quesadilla, this is your place. Short three block walk and I can guarantee you that your pockets will thank you!!

Likes:
-quick service
-great flavor
-flexible hours (open early and pretty late)
-inexpensive

Dislikes:
-minimum for credit card transactions
author: Tracy T.

description: Overall good, but.... Meat looked like it had been sitting for a while and they used a microwave to melt cheese on nachos, kind of a turn off. They were out of taco salad shells but overall was pleased with the food - fresh, fast. Good location to take back to our hotel after a long day touring the city. HUGE portions. I would go again.
author: Jonathan M.

description: El sol is a small taqueria with great food. I like the chile verde and the pollo asado. Always good and fresh. They have a full, easy to read menu. Their salsas are very flavorful and the spicy has a good kick. Portions are generous. Excellent guacamole. The burritos, flautas, enchilada and more are all very satisfying.
author: Menehune D.

description: Best baby burrito ever! I ordered baby burrito with carne asada with everything. Good size and delicious.
author: Yujin J.

description: El Sol is a decent taqueria in the area.   I went here with a couple of friends before having drinks at Jones and had their Super Quesadilla with Carnitas.  It was a good sized quesadilla.  The carnitas was good and definitely filled me up for the night.  It surely is a good spot for loading up before going out to all the nearby bars.
author: Rodney H.

description: Went here late last night, got chorizo super burrito.  This place is nothing fancy but it's a good quick late night option.
author: Dave G.

description:
I've probably eaten 300 burritos from this place. They are solid and reliable. I like the baby burrito--great value. 

Al pastor, chicken, carne asada are all great. I also really like the roasted salsa. 

It's not really a place to sit down in, but it's great for takeout. It's my go to burrito in the neighborhood, and I'm grateful for it. 

I also like the chorizo breakfast burritos.
author: R S.

description: Food didn't seem extremely fresh. Spent $25 bucks for two seemed like a deal but we walked out hungry. Chicken and carne Asada lacked flavor and the chicken was thigh meat not Breast. No water or fountain drinks.
author: Joseph M.

description:
I am a huge fan of this place and eat here several times a week. The people there are so friendly and the burritos more filling than Chipotle. You should be supporting small, family-owned establishments like this!

The breakfast chorizo burritos they have are probably their biggest secret. Not many people are there at morningtime compared to later. It's absolutely fantastic. Ditto the spicy SuperBurrito. You get a lot of crazies wandering outside the entrance, but that's life in the Loin.
author: Jay N.

description: Couple of my choost fwendies &  I  was craving some breakfast burritos,  so we decided to stop by this local mom & pops shop, huge portions, delicious authentic Mexican food! All I can say is "yummy yum yum in my tummy!" We left this place with our stomachs full & smile on our faces...
author: Buddha B.

description: Good place to eat the owner she very nice lady
author: Khalid A.

description: Quick, easy, delicious. The homemade habanero Salsa is an excellent touch on everything.
author: Sanchit C.

description: Get burritos here about twice a week and while they're not the best in the City, they are well made and satisfying. I typically get Verde chicken or carnitas. The grilled chicken isn't too flavorful to me. I also love the quesadillas and shrimp tacos.
author: Edwin R.

description: Good food and decent prices. The baby burrito is a good middle ground option. Also I was accosted by a transient but it's San Francisco so you get used to it
author: Jonathan Q.

description:
El Sol is my favorite taqueria in this part of the Tenderloin. I prefer it over El Tesoro and La Rosa, which are both nearby. El Tesoro is decent and I know some folks who go there plenty. As for La Rosa, I'd rather eat whatever I can find strewn about on the streets. So naturally, you'll find me ordering a chicken burrito or some nachos at El Sol Taqueria. 

I usually order to-go since the taqueria doesn't have much seating. Sometimes when it's not busy, I'll dine in and watch the show outside that is our beloved Tenderloin. 

This is your standard taqueria. I give them 5 stars because I come in here a lot and their service is always awesome. ¡Me encanta!
author: Sethy Wethy ..

description:
It's a very casual spot but the food is authentic and so tasty that you'll get addicted and keep coming back for more.

My fave: super burrito with barbacoa beef. Dress it up, they have all the goodies!

Value: very good. Around $10-12 for a very filling meal.
author: Morenita C.

description: Beef taco and horchata. Beef was tough and had been sitting under a heat lamp too long. Other ingredients seemed fresh.  Horchata was OK. Service was OK.  I won't go back.
author: Neal W.

description: My favorite Mexican restaurant in the area. It's nothing fancy, however, the food is definitely a 5-star. Very authentic flavors and the portions are just right. Also, the staff is very friendly and prices are not too bad. I highly recommend it if you are looking for good food with authentic Mexican flavors and not looking for a restaurant just for the ambiance.
author: Karla D.

description: Really great regular burrito! It's huge and the meat/rice is seasoned perfectly. Good price too considering the size. Would be giving five stars but for the disappointing chips and salsa. Chips are just generic mission tortilla chips---not warm or cooked in house. Portion of chips is also really paltry (small sandwich bag). The "hot" salsa is pretty mild as well.
author: Semuteh F.

description:
Good food at a good price.  Small eating area, but still nice.   

Had the El Veggie burrito and it was the best.  Nicw alternative to the overpriced food in the area.
author: Mihael H.

description: Woke up hungry on Sunday morning. After a night out of drinking my body was craving something hearty. Luckily this place was open early. 10am. And fixed me up a great breakfast burrito. English is tough for the staff but the food is worth it.
author: Harry M.

description:
This place is less than a block from me and when I was craving Mexican, I decided to give this place a try.  It was good Mexican for decent price!  I ordered the dinner chicken enchiladas and it came with 2 enchiladas, refried beans, rice, lettuce, salsa, guac (didn't charge extra for this), and sour cream.  It ran me around $14 with tax, which is pretty pricey for one person but since the entree was so large, it made sense.  They also give you free chips & salsa which adds a nice touch to things.  

This place is quick and has the option for you to sit-down or carry out.  They take credit cards ($8 minimum) which is nice and has about 5 varieties of Jarritos drinks (which I found out, Mango, is officially the best one now lol)

Overall, I've had better enchiladas in my life but given the location, speediness of orders and quality of food, I'd give this place 4 stars.
author: Anna G.

description: The veggie burrito is super tasty and hits the spot! Very flavorful and nice soft tortilla ^_^
author: Diana C.

description: Excellent burritos. I usually order the regular steak. It's nice and hot. I also like that they offer a baby burrito. This place always gets my burrito right. That's why I've been going out of my way to eat here, even though I live next to another Mexican restaurant.
author: Nathan Anthony R.

description: They charged me twice for 2 tacos $11 instead of $6. When I called them they said oh and hung up.
author: daina v.

description: Been living out of the country for 5 years and really missed authentic Mexican food. This place was spot on. Simple, made to order, mission-style burritos -- of which the fish burrito is my personal favorite. (Not on the menu, but they will make it for you.) Open to midnight too, which is nice for late night food cravings. Recommended.
author: Joshua L.

description:
Quesadilla ... Disgusting 
Absolute worse I've had EVER. 
Taco was a little better..
Should of settled for a pizza across the street.
author: Demanding T.

description: Was so hungry, came to my hotel, needed something to eat. Stumbled upon this small joint.... Ordered the veggie burrito. HUGE. Comes with chips and salsa. Delicious, definitely hits the spot. With a diet coke and veggie burrito, it comes to about $9, not bad.
author: Kristin S.

description:
It's a consistently decent place to get some fat tacos.  I've been there 20-30 times and only one time was sub-par, which is a great track record.

Green chile chicken FTW.
author: Ed N.

description: Bummer. I've been coming to the place since day one and just had a cold carne asada burrito and now I'm that idiot who didn't wanna complain so I'm here writing a Yelp review. It's close to closing and I ate cold meat. bummed.
author: Chauntae M.

description: A little ma and pa shop close to my hotel. Stumbled across this place when looking for a burger joint.  I reluctantly went into this tiny place. The food did not look appetizing at all...a little old but i was starving...hot off a 7 hour flight so i ordered the chicken quesadilla and the taco. It didn't come with the usually sour cream and salsa which was a bit surprising. The chicken in the taco was old and cold. The chicken quesdilla was ok nothing special. Dont think I'll be going back.
author: Chrystal Q.

description:
I read lotsa reviews before trying it, and yelpers seemed to like it! I got the vegetarian nachos and here was process: Chips on plate. Shredded cheese on chips. Microwave. 

I paid 7 bucks for microwaved nachos. Nuh uh. Nuh uh. Maybe their other stuff is good, but I can eat rubbery chips for free at home.
author: Cecilia A.

description: Coming down from the Seattle area, this place was calling to me from the moment I noticed it,  across from our hotel!  For $9.16 I got ALL of the food in the picture!   It's excellent value for all this deliciousness!
author: Darcie M.

description:
First I am a little biased. Raised in San Diego and spent a lot of time in Mexico. SD/ LA I have a spoiled pallet. 

My bar in SF is Pancho Villas so this place had a lot to compete with.
_______

I live above this spot so I thought I would try it out one night. Affordable but still not worth the price. 

The tortilla on my burrito was cold, which to me is a no no. Chips are not made fresh, and the meat was dry. Spicy salsa was mildy spicy. 

This is a spot you go to LATE and night if you are starving or drunk. 

Not disgusting, but there are better spots around the corner.
author: Sharon S.

description:
Very bad customer
Service and 11 dollars for a burrito that you can buy some where for 9 dollars and more tasty
author: Jose G.

description: I believe the price of their super burrito has been raised and the burrito size has stayed the same. If you want a huge burrito that's tasty and worth your $10 then go to the Mission. Disappointed about the credit card minimum (although they can't actually enforce it), being charged 10¢ for a bag without even being asked first, and the positive impression that I have previously had of this taqueria.
author: Kali C.

description:
Nice tacos, burritos in tenderloin/union square.

Good taste, there is better places like pancho villa but was happy after my visit.
author: Patrik D.

description: I was planning to review this place a week ago but let me tell you the burritos here are delish the girl marking the food English is not much she added sour cream on my burrito. I hate sour cream. They remade the burrito and it was good as always . I wish they open late .
author: Veronica L.

description:
My cousin let my mom have a bite of her burrito and from then on my mom has been asking me to get her one. 

I came here with her and ordered the Super Burrito. I thought the super burrito would be bigger than the regular but it just comes with cheese, sour cream, and guc which the regular doesn't come with. Seeing how I know I can't finish a burrito and its technically my mom's first time we ordered one to share. 

The lady who took made our burrito was very nice. We asked her to cut our super burrito in half. She wrapped each again in foil so it looked like we ordered two really small burritos. The burrito was good but nothing amazing. 

This is a good place if you are hungry and want a place to sit where people will leave you alone. Although the place is small I think there is always a place to sit if you need. I once randomly walked by around 9pm and saw my friend sitting there enjoying a burrito. He got off work really late and this was the only place where he could get something hearty and where he can dine by himself.
author: Sarah C.

description: They need to tune up their microwave.  The cheese enchiladas were cold, and the cheese was not even melted inside. The sauce - which was basically ketchup - didn't help. That on a little platter, with no drink, cost $14.
author: Mark W.

description:
Great little hole in the wall that was open late the night I went there.  Very courteous and great set up whereby you pick the ingredients you want in your burrito and they make it right there in front of you like chipotle. 
No frills but that's not really necessary for hole-in-the-wall Mexican joints.  I would say it delivers in every way possible.
author: Alex A.

description: Excellent highly recommend plenty of food we were down on our luck and had to panhandle for our food but this was well spent money the best hear Union Square
author: Paul K.

description: Place is small and clean they have a score of 86 I believe. The food isn't amazing And needs work when it comes to flavor. The burrito I've gotten for the second time isn't that good and it's not worth the price. You're better off going to a better place two blocks down. However if you're close by and you're not in the mood to eat food at work, it's okay I guess. Not my first or even my second choice when it comes to Mexican food. No where close to amazing or good, but it's okay.
author: Antonio C.

description:
I have been a big fan of Iguanas in San Jose. Beside the mediocre Chipotle, I hadn't been able to find another good place to get burritos until I found El Sol! Their pollo asado is lean and not cooked greasy. Their regular burrito can fill me up all day. It's $6.95. My favorite burrito is rice, black beans, pollo asado, lettuce, and salsa. Simple and yummy! 
The staff is nice :)
Small place. They also asked if I wanted chips and salsa. I said no. I didn't know if they were free. If they are, too bad I didn't get them. But, I will cause I am going to go back for sure!
author: Ervi L.

description:
This taqueria is nearby from my crib. As a result, I came here for lunch and dinner. 

For lunch, I had a Carnitas (Grilled Pork) Super Burrito for $6.95. That Burrito has rice, choice of beans, sour cream, rice, cilantro, onions, cheese, and lettuce (an item I didn't want in my burrito, but was given to me) blanketed in a flour tortilla. The Super burrito's size is smaller than some of the burrito I've had, but wrapped tightly.  The filling was fresh and stored properly, but the rice tasted kind of dried. A mediocre burrito, wishing I should have gone to Mission St. instead. This place is small with only five tables, as a result for lunch; I was forced to take my lunch home. Luckily I paid my lunch with cash, because minimum credit card purchase is $10.00.

For Dinner, I took my wife here after she got off work and ate in the restaurant. She had two Super Grilled Steak Tacos. Each taco costing $4.25 had the choice of meat, lettuce, salsa, cheese, sour cream and guacamole on top of a corn tortilla. She also bought a bottle of Negro Modelo beer and enjoyed her meal. I had the Grilled Steak and Prawn Combination Dinner (#1). My $11.00 meal has the meat and two sets of prawns on skewers with rice, beans salsa, sour cream and guacamole in a plate. The seafood was good and the rice was fresher than my midday visit, but the meat was tad too burnt and salty. Even my $1.00 can of Diet Coke could not extinguish the saltiness from the meat. 

My subpar meal has forced me to tell my wife to charge our meal. Eventhough this taqueria is close to my house, I still have questionable thoughts about coming here again.
author: Matt G.

description:
This isn't the taqueria you go out of your way to dine at. El Sol taqueria is small about four tables and there food is edible while the service comes with a smile.
The best thing about their standard taqueria menu is the baby burrito, a small burrito for those of us who watch their manly physiques or people with small stomachs.
They offer chips and salsa with their meals and  have some horchata or agua fresca.
I've had the quesadilla  and their tacos; they were filling but something totally awesome seemed to be missing from the food.
author: Alexander R.

description:
I decided to walk to work today instead of getting the bus and passed by this place. They had a sign outside advertising breakfast burritos, so I decided to give it a try. There was actually no sign of a breakfast burrito on the menu board, but they do have it. I must say it was one of the tastiest breakfast burritos I've had in a long time.

Fried potatoes, freshly cracked eggs (not from a carton like some other places), a generous helping of cheese and a sizeable amount of salsa made this a fantastic breakfast. I asked for it without meat, but it seems you can get it with chorizo also. It cost under $5, which was a lot less than I was expecting. I will definitely be back to try their other options.
author: Gary M.

description: my favorite mexican food. amazing quality and good price, i would love to see them use the second story for seating
author: Cara D.

description:
Tasty food and friendly staff. I get my lunch here every couple of days. I'm not a connoisseur, I just like burritos!

NB: there's not much seating space.
author: Steve J.

description: Was around the area looking for something to eat and we came across this place. Small location , few tables. The variety of burrito sizes varies from regular to super to baby burrito. Wasn't sure exactly what the size difference was from super to baby because they both had the same contents. The burrito was good, they had a variety of meats like al pastor, asada, chicken. Very good burrito. Their horchata drink was bomb!
author: Melissa M.

description: It was good food, nothing extraordinary, but decent, good food for the money made quickly with a friendly staff. What more could one want?
author: Martha H.

description: My favorite in my proxy! Never too greasy and the salsas are fresh! Love the service fast and friendly.... Chile verde chicken burrito and the flautas are my go to indulgences. Breakfast burritos are tasty and filling:)
author: yvette c.

description:
This place is pretty good. I usually stop by here on my way back from school or work sometimes. Although, I think the chips that come with the meal can be a little stale sometimes. 

The guacamole portions are great if you're just buying that alone.
author: Kissy F.

description:
Once in a while, I'd order their super quesadilla, which I used to love. Well, i still do, but it shrinked in size almost double and this fact I don't really like. 
And I want to think it depends on who is cooking, coz last 3 times there was a lady, taking my order and cooking and it is really smaller than the one I used to get from the man. It's still enough to get really full, but before it made 2 meals for me ;-))
And if comparing pricing: it's $1 or $2 more expensive than in major taquerias. Ok for me since it's tasty.
Not familiar with any other items.
So, taking off 1 star for shrinking in size and I also was charged $1 for 2 extra small conteiners of  salsa (minus 2nd star), even though I didn't want their chips, so they might 've given it to me just instead....
author: Anastasia B.

description:
My husband and I were dedicated to this place for the last year before we moved away from our beloved city.

We only lived a block away, and seriously, the amount of GOOD food you get for the price is enough to keep you. I would get the baby burrito and still have some left over.  We live in Southern California now, with Mexican restaurants on every corner, but it's just not the same. Kirkland brand guacamole oozes from your burritos here. I miss my chunky avocado pieces.

I miss you, El Sol. We will definitely be back again.
author: Catherine H.

description: The burritos and tacos are decent. Avoid the nachos as they always come out soggy after they microwave it.
author: Daniel R.

description:
I can't believe I haven't written a review yet especially since I'm a regular here.   It's always consistent and on every level - food and customer service.  
The staff is here is very nice, friendly, and you can tell they work hard.  They're flexible to catering to whatever type of burrito you want - love that.  They're pretty swift with service - you're in & outta there in no time.  LOVE!
author: Meredith K.

description: Very good service, quick! Everything delicious! Very Clean! Price just right not overpriced everything fresh!
author: Oliver W.

description: Had the carnitas and beef burritos on separate occasions. Both were really good, though I prefer their pork one. If your in the union square area, forget the Chipotles and walk down to El Sol instead.
author: Jordan C.

description: This is a small taqueria downtown. It does what I need it to do - it gives me fast, quick, pretty hot burritos for relatively (SF prices) cheap. Obviously it would be better if the ingredients were made-to-order rather than buffet style, but then again that would take away from the "fast" aspect that I so desire. So overall, this place is legit. If they eliminated their minimum for credit card processing so I could get points on my dining rewards I would go there even more often.
author: Brian S.

description: Besides being able to practice my Spanish with the workers, they also have an amazing burrito that was both huge and very affordable (especially in SF). One thing I didn't like was the fact that their salsa wasn't really spicy enough for me. The quesadilla was alright but I'd definitely recommend the burrito any day
author: Bibiano L.

description:
You don't always have to go to The Mission for an amazing burrito.  And this is an amazing example of that simple fact. 

I really want to drag this story out.  I feel like it deserves a really unique one, with a twist ending.  I just realized I'm calling my reviews stories now though.  Anyway, back on track...

Simply put, they make great burritos.  They even offer what is now my personal menu favorite, "The Baby Burrito."  This is exactly the same as a "Super Burrito," just smaller. And believe me, it's plenty big.  But the bonus is that you don't feel terrible about yourself if you eat the entire thing.  Unless the only thing you fill it with is sour cream and chorizo.  Then you should feel bad.

Twist ending.  San Francisco is considering extending the cut off point of The Mission to Geary and Jones just because of this place, and so they can name it "Mission Burrito of the Year."  You're welcome.
author: John R.

description: Tired of bridesmaid dress shopping, we almost went to Colibri down the street. Thank GOD we walked out of there before paying $17 for an empanada because El Sol has delicious meat, a variety of it, and I think the four of us payed $17 for all our food. Which left more money for beer....and a dollar for the homeless man that poked his head in.
author: Olivia I.

description:
Looking forward to the day when declining rice and chips is seen as a fair trade for lettuce and a wheat tortilla instead. Today was not that day. El Sol did pile on the grilled chicken and friendly service, the slab was quite good, but can't quite call it a deal at $7 and change, which included an extra charge for the aforementioned wheat tortilla. Think they slid the lettuce in there. Thanks for that.

A strong three star burrito.
author: Jason B.

description:
This is the best hole in the wall, bang for your buck restaurant in DT San Fran. I visit every time I'm in town. The home made burritos are HUGE and CHEAP. 
I'm from Texas and love Mexican food and I love this place. Be advised as its more for take out than sitting in, but you can buy beer to go too.
author: Tim R.

description: I really enjoyed my food but my boyfriend didn't care too much for his. I got a vegetarian burrito with pinto beans and green salsa and without sour cream or cheese. The salsa was really tangy and the burrito was warm and delicious and super filling. He got a beef burrito and said that it wasn't bad but he wasn't impressed. The chips were not good though, stale and bland and kinda squished in a weird little plastic bag. We were really tired and hungry and were ready to eat pretty much whatever, but I actually liked my food and I wouldn't mind going back and eating there again.
author: Victor B.

description:
I eat here at least once a week and love it. It's fast, convenient and delicious. The people are nice and friendly, the burritos are huge, and it's cheap! I'm not saying this is the best Mexican food I've ever had, but it's pretty damn close. 

PS. the quesadillas are yummy and greasy as well!
author: Peggy L.

description: I read dozens of reviews before getting a vegetarian burrito tonight. This is decent Mexican food. You can only do so many things with rice, beans, tortillas, etc. It can't be less than 3 stars if you like Mexican food, nor more than 4 stars unless you haven't eaten for a month. My burrito was $7.64, rather a lot for a RBC burrito, but it was freshly prepared in front of me, large, and as tasty as RBC can be.  I may eat here again, but not worthy of a special trip.  A solid 3.
author: Eric H.

description: Food was okay.  Had the super burrito al pastor.  Truth be told have had better.  Not too much flavor.  The salsa for the chips was good.  . Staff was friendly.
author: Francisco R.

description: Ordered the carnitas and beef tacos from El Sol. The tortillas were so soggy I couldn't pick up the tacos, which were really too huge for tacos. My friend got the nachos, which actually looked much more appetizing. Given the amount of delicious, authentic Mexican food in the Bay Area, I doubt I'll try this place again.
author: Kate P.

description: all ingredients are perfect, no matter what you mix, it's all excellent. can I have the everything burrito? thank you, you're welcome.
author: Gerardo C.

description:
We were wandering endlessly in the union square neighborhood, looking for food.  We'd walked down market from 8th Street to union square, just crappy fast food on market.  We thought we could find food in union square, but no.  All we could find was expensive food and starbucks.  Lots of starbucks.  We found a diner on a corner, but not one vegetarian thing on the menu except breakfast (pancakes).  We found another place with $10 sandwiches -- too expensive.

Walking west, we finally found Taqueria El Sol at Jones & Geary, right across from Millenium.  If we were rich, we'd have lunched at Millenium, of course.  But we were looking more for something in the $5 range.  This place fit the bill.  We each got the vegetarian burrito, which was $5.95 plus tax = $6.35.  They had other vegetarian options like nachos, quesadillas, tacos.  And the usual meat options in those forms, plus extra.

One thing I really liked about this place, is that our burritos were made to order, customized right in front of our eyes.  I picked which beans I wanted, how much of lettuce, cheese, etc., I wanted, and I could see each step.  Everything seemed clean.  And I got my burrito the way I wanted it.

Maybe I was just really thirsty, but the glass of tap water I got was great.  No ice, but nice and cold, but not too cold, just cool and refreshing.  Ah.  And free.  My BF got a bottled beverage.

There are only four tables in this tiny place, but it was nice enough -- no wobbly table, no stickyness.  The burrito was among the best I've had.  It was longer and slimmer than most -- same total size as usual, but a much easier shape to handle.  And the ingredients were throughout, as opposed to those burritos where you get bites of beans, and then later big bites of guac, etc.

The burrito came with a little cup of salsa and a little plastic baggie of chips.  The baggie looked small, but I think there were as many chips as you usually get at this type of place.  Or almost.

Overall, I recommend.
author: Stacey B.

description: I seriously love this place. I have a pepper allergy, but love mexican food, which is a problem. They go out of their way to make sure I can eat what I want. Went in last night for a shrimp burrito, and it was incredible. All it was was shrimp, cilantro, onions, refried beans, guac, sour cream, and cheese and it was unreal. Each ingredient is so flavorful you don't need to get all crazy.
author: Erica C.

description:
When you go to this place, don't get the traditional burrito you'd get at Chipotle or in the Mission. Get the super quesadilla, and here's why:

Most taquerias make their quesadillas with only the meat and cheese inside, leaving the guacamole, sour cream and salsa on the side for dipping. El Sol doesn't force you to make this mess. They cook everything inside the quesadilla in one massive, sturdy tortilla, and will make it extra crispy for no charge. It's a great balance of ingredients, too, making each bite a burst of unforgettable flavor.

I used to live a block away, and during that year I frequented this little place at least once or twice a week. I'm not a snobby "mission-district-only" type or a SoCal boy, so I'm not going to brag about how much better everything is in SD, the Mission or LA and refuse to be satisfied with anything outside of my selfish bubble. I don't care about how "authentic" it is. It's all about the taste, and this place hits the spot. It's so yummy.

A few other good things to note:

-They serve beer.
-They are very friendly and even know my order. They even start making it the moment I walk in.
-They are efficient, even for newcomers, and reasonably priced.

My only nitpick is that it's so small. There's seating for maybe eight people, but it's never really too crowded.
author: Eliot R.

description: Great place, authentic food. Fastly made, lost of choises to make. Whether you want chicken or beef and so on... The tables were clean and the floor was suprisingly clean. The only thing is that they don t have a lot of tables for 4.
author: Daan D.

description:
Disclaimer:  Moving from southern California where there is a burrito and taco place on every corner and where the traditional fish taco got it start my review may be a bit jaded.

I ordered the vegetarian burrito and a fish taco.  Every part of both were  dull and flavorless.  No spice or taste to the guacamole.  It seems if they had just combined blended avocado with some mayo and left it at that.  The beans looked like they had just came straight out of the can watery and runny.  The fish was actually  grilled to order which I surprised about.  But it just came out greasy and the breading simply did not exist.  The best part of the entire meal was the horchata which was light creamy with out being overly sweet.  The prices were a bit high for this type of establishment especially how close to the loin it is located but then again this is San Francisco. I do not see my self coming back to El Sol unless I am very very drunk and just cant resist my craving for burrito
author: Morgan C.

description: I stopped in here before the Das Racist concert at Ruby Skye the other night. I was trying to find quick veggie/vegan food. I ordered the veggie burrito. I was pleasantly surprised to find out that it actually comes with vegetables. They threw in cauliflower, broccoli, peppers and zucchini. I also got black beans and rice and lettuce and salsa all up in my tortilla. I like how they didn't just heat up the tortilla. They let some parts get a little golden and slightly crispy. I have a little crush on this burrito now.
author: Daisy S.

description: Message to the owner: dude, you want 50 Cents for an extra tiny cup of salsa? That is rediculous. I have plenty of other options for mexican food in this city. Your food is good, but you guys wanted to charge me for that. I expect that kind of lameness from chipolte not you folks. Please change you stupid policy. You just lots $$$ in business from me. Change your policy and I will return.
author: Frank F.

description:
So my friend and I went here because it was walking distance from his apartment.  He says, "It's not the most amazing but you won't regret a steak and prawn burrito". 

So, being the showman, I tell the guy making the burrito, "Ranchero Beef and Prawn Burrito".  

He gives me a double take but obliges.  His wife stands there just beside herself laughing. She laughed at me until we left. Haha.

The custom Ranchero beef and prawn burrito was amazing, and the reason I've given El Sol 4 stars.

But more amazing was this epiphany I had: Most of us have 'been around the taco truck' with mexican fast food and I think we've come to this place where we can turn just about any mediocre mexi-restaurant into a fiesta by customizing our orders.  And while I may have made the biggest joke of a choice to the owner lady, the outcome was this amazing mouth orgy burrito that I will never forget.


Cheers.
author: Jacob N.

description:
Well... more like 3.5 Stars.

Was running around Union Square before a Bday get together and decided to grab a quick bite. Not the best super burrito I've had but it still was pretty good. Actually, the best part was the lengua. Yes, the tongue. It was done very well here. VERY tender (like fall apart tender) and stewed in a very good sauce. Plus, they pack the burritos up with meat and cheese! (could of used less sour cream, however)... add in the Mexican Coke with extra sugar... and it was pretty tasty.

The prices are slightly higher than the joints down on Mission or the Oakland taco trucks... but it's still worth the price.
author: Mike A.

description:
Nope, still not sick of burritos.

I was enticed by the cactus and goat cheese burrito on the otherwise no-nonsense menu but when I tried to order it my request was declined. Instead, I enjoyed a vegetarian burrito here and I loaded it up with tomatoes, black beans, rice, and enough guacamole to fill an Olympic-sized swimming pool. 

I devoured the little bromigo so quickly that I didn't even notice that I had also swallowed more than a few square inches of tinfoil. Oh, and one of them was conveniently affixed to a few of my teeth - homemade grillz, anyone?
author: Kat F.

description:
One of the BEST Burritos I have ever had!
Their Mojado Burrito is amazing! I loved it!!!

Definitely one of the best places for Quick and Fast Mexican food in the neighborhood... DELICIOUS!! (and I'm picky with mexican food)
author: JD G.

description:
So it's 10pm PST, I'm tired and verrrrrrry hawngry. All I want is some grub and my hotel pillow. Some of my colleagues step into a Mediterranean place around the corner, but I'm in no mood for tabbouleh and gyros. I need some hearty stuff...the kind that will put me to sleep with happy dreams.

I spotted El Sol Taq while rounding the corner...all it took was the neon "TACOS BURRITOS" in the window to get me to stop in. While I was making my decision from the extensive menu (considering the small joint that it is), some dude came in and ordered up some tacos and quesadillas. I was torn between the two myself but I after I saw the shiz they piled on those tacos, I knew it was the only way to go.

I got one chicken taco, one veggie. Holy crow Batman...they pile them high! Cheese, beans, rice, meat, lettuce, sour cream, guac and salsa. Bring it on! I was salivating on my shirt by the time he closed the wimpy to-go container.

By the time that I got back to my room though, the paper container had given out and the goodness within had started to seep out. Boo. Another loss? It was going cold by the time I dug in. I couldn't tell if I scarfed it because it was that good, or because I was just that hungry. I think it was the latter.

A few of the chicken pieces and some rice was hard which made for an unpleasant crunch every few bites. The guac wasn't housemade (or at least it didn't taste like it), but the salsa was top-notch.

All in all, a decent quickie stop if you're low on choices. I would recommend eating it there or within a few minutes...otherwise, you'll be whipping out the Tide pen to take care of the bean juice dripping on your clothes.
author: Nikki B.

description: Tried a burrito and a quesadilla on separate occasions, and walked away happy.
author: Craig D.

description: Mmm... I highly recommend one of their giant quesadillas They're incredibly filling, delicious, and flavorful. My friend and I shared a beef and a pork quesadilla and could only finish 1/3 of each. Customer service was quick and friendly. Their flan however was bland.
author: Jennifer F.

description: Disappointing. I got the super quesadilla, which was small and not all that tasty. And it was quite expensive.
author: Paul O.

description:
I'm currently hooked on the El Veggie burrito here. In case anyone is wondering, I like it with:

black beans
guac
cheese
both salsas
green sauce to go

Someone mentioned frozen veggies I don't think so. 

Their deluxe veggie nachos are also a lot of fun when you're working from home.

They're always extremely nice here. I think they probably get a wacky crowd, but I also think this tiny place must be more pleasant to work in than one of the assembly line places in the Mission. People are always sitting in and eating here - the street outside can be pretty gnarly so it's not for the people watching. Well or maybe it is. :-)
author: Roxmarie M.

description:
It's cheap, close, and.... delicious! what more can I ask for? 
Sometimes on my way back, if I'm too hungry and impatient to cook or order delivery food, I'd pick up a burrito here.
author: Miss C.

description:
Coming from LA, I think I can say I've had sooo many good mexican food around me until I came to SF.
HOWEVER, when my lovely bf found out about this place, we came here atleast twice a week. (we just moved so now it's only once a week) 
This place seriously has the BEST shrimp burritos I have ever had in my entire life. I went to Cozumel, Mexico this summer and although the gaucamole is better in Cozumel, I was actually craving El Sol Taqueria's shrimp burrito. That's how good it is.
The main guy who works here is super kind which makes my ordering experience better.

SERIOUSLY PEOPLE! if u want good mexican food, u HAVE to eat here. I've tried at least a dozen mexican restaurants in SF and no one can compete.
now I'm craving a shrimp burrito. damn it
author: Jessica M.

description:
A workmanlike burrito, it just keeps its head down and gets the job done. It has everything you need and nothing you don't; a real meat-and-potatoes, lunchbox variety burrito, only it doesn't have potatoes in it and people generally don't carry lunchboxes anymore. You know what I'm getting at.

I probably wouldn't make a special trip if I had to drive here, but it is the best spot within a reasonable walking distance of my house (the GF thinks it's one of the best burritos she's ever had but she's from Kansas so what the hell would she know?). I don't even bother walking the extra block and a half to El Tesoro anymore because El Sol has it locked down, and they have Squirt in a glass bottle. Most mexican places have Coke in glass, but Squirt? That's rare. I've eaten burritos from here two days in a row before, which is pretty much the highest compliment I could ever pay a taqueria.

The younger lady who works there rolls her burritos big and tight, like the tightest I've ever had. She could get a job as a hand roller at a cigar factory in a Cuba with her skills. The jury is out on whether that would be better or worse than working at a Tenderloin taco shop.
author: Trav W.

description:
"Hell hath no fury as a woman's scorn." **shakes fist at El Sol**

I ordered 2 burritos: a vegetarian and a carne asada super burrito w/out sour cream.

Veggie = rice + beans (your choice): BLAND! How do you make something so greasy taste like nothing?!?

Carne asada burrito: Can best be described in the words of my bf, "I can taste all the ingredients SEPARATELY." No bueno. It's sounds weird, but every bite you could taste the rice...and then the beans...and then the meat, etc. 

ONE star for the friendly customer service.

Needless to say, it was an odd experience and I am still perterbed whenever I pass by. I've been traumatized enough to stay away...for the time being...
author: Kristine W.

description:
As a Bay Area lifer, I can say without hesitation that el Sol makes the best damn veggie burrito I've had. I'm not saying there isn't stiff competition from the other joints (nod to La Victoria). But el Sol just gets it all right. From the taste of the ingredients to the quantity mashed into your choice of tortilla to the tight, easy-to-eat wrapping to the Mexican Coke. 

The folks that work there are super-nice, too, so dig deep when you tip.

Only nit I have is the size. Place is tiny.

Oh...and it's not in San Jose.
author: Paul W.

description: I have to say I'm extremely disappointed! This place held me down my first yr of law school living in the TL. The prawns burrito was EVERYTHING - I went last week for Fat Tuesday and it was such a waste of calories, it didn't have its usual freshness to it. It also lacked the unique flavors it once had. Also, they raised the price by ALOT. AND the store was pretty dirty from past patrons.
author: Adriana B.

description:
Contrary to popular belief there IS an authentic and inexpensive Taqueria close to Union Square and El Sol is it!  I've found this little place very convenient for a quick bite before catching a show at the Geary or Curran Theatre.

You won't be dissapointed, it's like a trip to The Mission without even having to pay for a Bart ticket!
author: Mike J.

description: Fast cheap, good, super burrito.
author: Neel M.

description:
Regular Nachos With Meat was a steal for $6.45!
Chunks of spicy, marinated chicken the size of a baby's fist!
Everything from the pico de gallo to the chips were high quality and tasty!
Don't worry about the small dining area, just sit next to the mirrored wall and contemplate the universe as you watch people on the street approach their own double, then collide and vanish!
author: CrapulentMoose ..

description: It's your average burrito place, but nowhere near what you can expect in the Mission.  For my money I'd rather go to Chipotle, which is only a few blocks away.
author: Mike D.

description:
My favorite burrito place in Union Square.  I absolutley love the super burrito.   They have awesome salsa's and great prices....extremely clean---- fast service, I love it!
Whatever you do try not to eat the entire super burrito in one sitting....I almost died of an overdose.  I couldn't stop!..its that good.
author: Michele K.

description:
I was all set to give a resounding thumbs up to El Sol based on a gigantic burrito I got there, hungover a few days ago. The thing was so big that the woman making it wasn't sure how to roll it. It took her a couple of attempts, but she got it and nothing came out the sides once I started it.

Sure, it was a prices (super burrito and a Mexican coke in a bottle=9.66,) but it comes with the territory, and for the girth and taste, I was ok with it.

But then my buddy showed up at Rug Jones with an El Sol burrito (based on my recommendation) and the thing was minuscule. 

I felt like an idiot.
author: Jason R.

description:
Lady behind the steam counter bosses las jovenes.  "Come with frijoles?" they ask, pan juice dripping from spoon to styrofoam.  

"Mmgh," she points.

"Tomates?"

"Mmgh."

A tiny cellophane baggy of chips, a fork, a napkin and a stray rubber band in the sack.  

Truth be told portions are stingy, tortillas few and brittle, meat  bland, prices fairly high.  But nothing diminishes the cheer of opening night.  With luck staff will figure out how to make a taco in a few weeks once she's not around to give them grief.

Simplified taqueria menu plus beer and wine.  Prawns and nachos yes, agua fresca, cabeza and brains no.  Two tables and a counter.  $5 to $6 for a burrito or $9 for una plata to give a point of reference.
author: Gil S.

description: Great inexpensive Mexican food. Definitely a hole in the wall but well worth it. Great portion sizes.
author: Finn F.

description: AMAZING prawn burrito (my husband and I make a point to visit their Dos Amigos location on Brannan every time we're in SF..tried this location for the first time last week - burrito tastes identical).  Kind of pricey ($8) if you can finish one by yourself...but they're big so we always manage to split one.  A handful of small tables inside.  Complimentary chips & salsa (teeny tiny portion).
author: Jennifer M.

description: "Meh" is the word.   Had the chicken enchilada plate, rellano and veggie tacos.  Everything was microwaved, right in front of us.  Meh.  I'm writing this review because I think the place was OK, but doesn't deserve the 4 stars it is getting... microwaved.. really.
author: Scott E.

description:
My boyfriend and I thought we'd try a new taqueria in our neighborhood, but after taking our first bite, we immediately regretted our flippant decision. Actually, it was before the first bite.  The prices are outrageous. Seven+ bucks for a burrito stuffed with frozen vegetables! And six+ dollars for the usual beaner veggie burrito? That's really uncool. Plus, what's going on with the burrito names? One is labeled vegetarian burrito, and the other is el veggie? Totally confusing! The burrito maker got confused too, and after she realized the mistake, she cooked the frozen veggies for about .5 and slopped it onto my rice n bean mix, then I guess she rolled it into what you could call a burrito. And, who doesn't drain the friggin beans before dropping them into the tortilla? I don't want bogged down, soggy rice. But really, what's the point when the rice is HARD. Not very good. 

But, they were nice and friendly, so no harm done really.
author: Brittany L.

description:
It drives me nuts when I read a review of a taqueria and people complain about getting sick.  It's a taqueria.  You're going to get sick.  Doesn't matter which one you go to.  Accept it, or just admit to your significant other that you don't actually like taquerias and stop the BS "oh, I can't eat an (delicious) SD style burrito because of that time I got sick" nonsense.  You didn't get sick, you just don't like taquerias.  Those sorts of head games are why your boyfriend is going to break up with you...soon.  Sorry in advance.

Anyway, I got food poisoning from El Sol.  Two days of misery was worth it to find out if they had the best SD style burrito.  They don't.  Alas, my journey continues, and I chalk up having a raw ass for a week as simply a battle scar in the war that rages on over which SF taqueria has the best SD style burrito.  The problem with the SD style burrito at El Sol seems to be common with the SD style burritos at other taquerias in SF: getting the proportions of the three ingredients right.  The flavors were eh but not bad.  The real issue was that the pico de gallo at El Sol is so heavy that the tortilla started to fall apart.  SD style burritos should never fall apart, unlike your relationship is about to (see first paragraph).
author: Paul M.

description:
The bottom line: standard menu, bland taste, inexpensive dining (in the Union Square area)

If you're short on time and cash, and not too picky on taste, this is your taqueria. Menu has all the favorites, but there isn't much fire behind any entree. Burritos are ok, but meat lacks seasoning. Not everything is fresh and made to order, such as the flautas and rellenos which have to be microwaved before they are served -- affecting their texture. Items have a "store-bought" quality, such as beans, flour torillas and chips for salsa-dipping. Prices are reasonable (for Union Square). Except for the dinner entrees which start at $8.95, everything on the menu is $6.95 or less. Burritos start at $4.95. Good selection of Mexican beers (Dos Equis, Tecate, Corona, Negra Modelo) and flavored sodas. Overall, this dining experience is slightly below average.

Sample entrees ($8.95): dinner plate w/ choice of meat, enchilladas (2), Flautas (3), Chile Relleno (2), Fajitas

Other: veggie burritos, fish/prawn tacos, various quesadillas
author: Tiger P.

description:
This is the worst taqueria I've been to in the city.  I've been there twice, and both times the burrito just wasn't fulfilling the way that burritos are from Taqueria Mana, El Castillito, or any of the wonderous Mission Taquerias.  Even Chipotle is better than El Sol.

That said, it's a cheap filling meal and I didn't get sick.
author: Joseph N.

description: This place is really really really really goood, just not great! It is a fantastic late night place to go a grab a few more beers and stuff your face full of tacos at the end of the night. I'm from Manhattan so we don't get the true authentic mexican food ever, all it is is hyped up mexican food made for tourists, so I really enjoyed my experience at El Sol. Like a lot of reviews said already the green chicken is the way to go so definitely grab some of that. The prices are low the taste is very very good so I gotta put this place on my recommendation list.
author: Shelly A.

description: Don't let the small hole in the wall facade deter you- this is one tasty taqueria. Had the chicken quesadilla and veggie burrito: fresh ingredients + SUPER friendly staff +reasonable prices = happy me. Giddyup!
author: Kim K.

description:
This place is great! I go here quite often for the super burrito. The staff is very nice, and the food is delicious!

Before I found this place I was HOOKED on Cancun. But I honestly think El Sol is better!
author: Doug W.

description:
I try not to ever go five stars, but screw it. this place was a wicked half drunk find.

i was headed home after drinks with my girlfriend and my brother, wondering what crap food i was going to eat once i got back to the haight, then i saw this place, it kinda reminded me of mexico and i was hungry, so i dove in.

the place is tiny. just a hole in the wall. don't let that detract anything. i got a couple of tacos carne and spoke in my broken spanish to the very nice senor on the other side of hte counter. he was patient with my poor spanish and said that he was happy to talk to a gringo en espanol. so that was cool.

very nice people working there, food was awesome and cheap and it's always fun to watch the fishbowl that is geary st.

so eff it, five stars.

as an aside, brittany a. likely doesn't eat in the city very often. are you even from here? $7 for a burrito is under the average.  sheesh.
author: Coe S.

description: On my way home Wed night, cruised up Geary Blvd towards J-Town looking for a taqueria and noticed a tiny shop "Taqueria El Sol".  The staff of two was friendly took my order generous portions, tasty super burritos & quesadillas - a little on the salty side (steak).  Best of all they fry fresh chips as I was waiting for my order.  I've found a new taqueria and street parking at 6pm.
author: Rich W.

description:
Went here for convenience the other evening. got myself a super taco and it was HUGE. meat was stacked upon other pieces of meat! don't even try to eat this with your hands...

it was good. in fact, quite good. 4 star good. but it is WTF expensive! i paid 7 or 8 bucks for this taco and a coke (which btw is the mexican coke).

1 star knocked off for these prices. ridick.
author: Victor B.

description: delicious burritos, really.  i'm very specific, they get it right every time. I was reluctant to try them as the previous mexican restaurant at this location wasn't too good but this place is acceptable.  they always wash their hands before making my food, i like seeing this and greatly appreciate it.  the food has tasted fresh, the restaurant is fairly clean, i keep coming back.  i have them make me my own customized vegetarian burrito as i don't like it soggy.  open until 11:00!
author: Noel J.

description:
Order something 1-2p or earlier. The ingredients are fresher in the morning where it first gets sliced and diced (including the pork, red meat and poultry), so thats usually when I step through the doors.

I've been there plenty of times. Its a small little space with just a hand full of employees. The guys and gals there are always smiling and nothing seems to get them down. Too bad it isnt owned and operated.

It came to a point where I dont even have to say what I want anymore, even though Im super picky with the things I want. I guess you can say Im a regular.

Minus 1 for the high prices :(
author: riz l.

description:
Minus one for the prices.
HOORAY for the baby burrito! I always find myself paying 4-8 bucks for a burrito and chips and never seem to finish the whole thing (i'm a little girl, I can't handle so much food!). The baby burrito is PERFECT for me and is always fulfilling. 
ALSO a huge fan because I did not have the right amount of change (total came to $10 and I only had 7 on me), the lady was nice enough to make it a total of $6.50. I felt horrible but the next time I went in I gave them an extra tip :)
Ingredients are def. more fresh in the early afternoon. After a night class a friend and I walked down to get in our burrito fix and although i was hungry enough to eat almost anything, the ingredients (veggies) didnt look as appealing.
May I also add some of the BEST salsa verde I've had in a while :)
author: Amanda S.

description: Whenever I start to feel lost in the sea of endless yuppies San Francisco has to offer, I can always count on the lady server with a gold tooth to make me feel like I'm in back at home in Oakland. Nothing beats authenticity...Plus, she always gives me two FULL scoops of chicken on my super burrito. She knows how to keep me coming back for more... Pancho Villa who?
author: Gregory B.

description: The boyfriend and I stumbled upon this place during our weekend trip to the city recently. This place has THE BEST vegetarian breakfast burrito I have ever eaten!!! Potatoes, black beans, egg, cheese, and spicy ass salsa. What more could I ask for? Oh yeah, some ridiculously good Horchata. EXCELLENT.
author: Cindy L.

description: I was so pleased that I could order my quesadilla the way I wanted it.  I ordered a quesadilla with half al pastor and half carne asada.  You must try the freshly made horchata it is like drinking a blended arroz con leche.
author: Nat N.

description: The food is great! Very authentic Mexican food. I ordered the combination of a quezadilla, a taco and an enchilada along with beans and rice. The food was great, my friends ordered burritos and they loved them! I would highly recommend!
author: Adriana S.

description:
Solid burrito (super, carne asada) and taquitos. Gotta try the shrimp

Hits the spot
author: xo x.

description: 2.5, actually. I pass this place every day and finally tried it out. Green chicken super quesadilla. Filling? Yes. Taste. Meh. Relatively cheap. VERY fast service. I probably won't be back though.
author: Liv B.

description:
So, this is my new favorite taqueria.  I went there with a friend a while ago since she kept raving about it and I have been hooked ever since!  The burritos are HUGE and delicious.  I love the super chicken burrito, the chicken is sooo good, it's in this delicious juice and they give large helpings. 

The baby burrito is the perfect size for a meal, the super burrito is for emergencies only a.k.a. severe hangovers. :)
author: Rachel S.

description:
The super burritos are alright.  

Don't get the nachos. They microwave them and this makes the steak taste chewy and weird.
author: Nathaniel G.

description: Awesome hole in the wall. Only four tables to sit at but we didn't have a problem walking in and snagging one. Truly authentic mexican food. Corona or Modela to choose from.
author: Tim H.

description: Ok food, burritos are big but 9 bucks is a little much!
author: Gilbert P.

description: I am not an expert on Mexican food, and know nothing about the standards in San Francisco since I am just a tourist, but I just came back from this place and the  food was great. I had a delicious Super Quesadilla and a very refreshing Horchata. The only reason I am not giving this place 5 stars is because the service wasn't the "friendliest".
author: jose g.

description:
This place is good for a quick meal under $10. I get the regular burrito with chicken and green salsa. Salty and to the point. I'd pass on the bagged chips unless they give them to you. They are always stale. 

I believe there is a minimum purchase to use a credit card, so use cash if you can.
author: BK R.

description:
This place is pretty crappy, but I've been a bunch of times since it's a block away.

The ingredients are not fresh (they use cheap Kirkland cheese), and the burritos are a bit overpriced.  Their nachos suck.

Not bad for a late night snack, but don't expect too much.
author: Adam W.

description:
food is pretty good, 

but what I really like about that place is that they see to have the nicest customer service I seen in any food place
author: jack a.

description: This place is where it's at for a burrito from carne asada to chicken verde!  Great for an after-drinks meal and chat (and/or more beer).  Kind of small inside but let's call it "cozy".  And the people are nice!
author: Justin B.

description:
The Hubby and I, new to the neighborhood, started eating here fairly frequently over the course of a few months. At first, the service was decent, the food was plentiful for the price, and we were happy with the service.

Fast forward a few weeks, we went in one day and asked for two veggie burritos. The lady gave me MUCH attitude, slamming the tortilla shell and the contents together, making it insanely small, and actually thought we would pay for full price for a large burrito.

We simply walked out and left the burrito there. I will NEVER return.
author: Juliste T.

description:
the burritos are huge and super tasty!

futbols on the screen and spanish flies between workers and locals... only way youre not in mexico is the prices are still SF high!
author: Kelsey W.

description: Worst  veggie burrito ever. No taste. Beans were tasteless, salsa was tasteless, frozen veggies were tasteless, "minute rice" was tasteless, chips were tasteless..guac was gross...I could go on.
author: Jessica K.

description:
El Sol lives up to its name, as in a shimmering beacon of light in the tenderest of loins. The folks who run this place are so nice they didn't even give the swift kick to a ditz girl for wishing them a happy cinco de mayo. I, however, made sure she tripped over a 12er of Corona on the way out. 

This joint brings it Subway style without the hideous cutout of that fat ass. All the ingredients are neatly laid out for your choosing, so if you like cheese you just keep telling them more cheese, more cheese, more cheese. Any place that doesn't pretend their s*** don't smell and let's you be in charge of the burrito ingredients is a place I want to take home to mom. 

Only bad thing: Their chips really, to put it plainly, suck. Sorry, guys, but I love you anyway.
author: Max D.

description: This place is right around the corner from me, I go here twice a week. The quesadillas & the burritos are awesome!
author: timothy h.

description: YES, YES, YES.  Everytime I go here I get the baby burrito and it is heaven in a tortilla.  Not only is the food bangin', but the way they wrap up those burritos in foil is nothing short of Mexican genius.  I go here weekly.
author: Kim K.

description: The four stars is for the super nachos.  I once had a super burrito here and it was mediocre.  The super nachos though, were amazing.  I got the grilled chicken with the hot salsa and had them put some cilantro on it.
author: JOHN G.

description: This is currently my favorite burrito place in my neighborhood.  They make a mini burrito which I love...regular size burritos are always way too much but I eat usually end up with an empty wrapper anyway.  I've had the chicken and the shrimp.  I recommend the shrimp - I think it is worth the extra $2.  The hot salsa is quite tasty and adds a lot of flavor to the burrito.  The prices are good and the place looks cleaner than most in the TL.  Sure, I've had better burritos but Taqueria El Sol is my first choice when I want a burrito and don't want to make my way to the mission.
author: Julie P.

description: I asked for a super burrito, I got a "regular" without the good fatty sour cream & guac. I paid in cash, so they didn't believe me when I went up to get the stuff that was supposed to be included in the super burrito price- so I paid twice for my sour cream & guac. There's a definite language barrier. The guacamole is good but I can make better. The salsa (pico de gallo) is very liquified. If you get anything in a tortilla, it'll be soggy. The meat and cheese is pretty safe- no bad incidents later during the day after eating here.
author: Braden B.

description: Solid little place.  We got a super burrito and super nachos and they were both delicious.  Prices were very reasonable if I remember correctly.  There's only room for about 6 people to sit in the store, so plan on getting it to go.  The menu doesn't contain anything out of the ordinary for taquerias.  Standard goodness.
author: Levi B.

description: Not bad late at night and when you are hungry.  Super burrito is big and filling.  Price is good.  Quality could be better, but it is an authentic place.
author: Jose C.

description: We had a super beef quesadilla and a super vegetarian burrito. Both dishes were tasty, I will definitely go back. The two people behind the counter were very nice!
author: Bogee B.

description:
They might be a 4 star taqueria.  I'm not going to stand around and argue about it.  I got better things to do, like draw pictures of wierd people walking around outside this loaf slinger.

So about their food.  I have eaten tortas, tacos and loafs and they are all good albeit a tad pricey ($7 loaf, fully stacked, tightly wrapped, in a foil tomb to warm up your lap).  Rather than drone on and on about all of the good and bad aspects of the place, I will concentrate on one good because I do like these people and what they do, while genuinely wishing the best to them and theirs.  So here goes; They take pork, perhaps some shoulder or butt, and the boil then bejesus out of it.  Next they take these savory chunks of hog and throw them in the deep fryer.  This produces a material that is crisp on the outside but oh so juicy in the middle.  Properly seasoned and loaded into a stainless steel trough and what we got are some muy bueno carnitas.  I highly recommend masticating some of these to fill your hungry tummy.  Tell them to twist those up with some black beans, cheez, guacamole, salsa, onions, rice and jalepenos, and you have a mighty delicious loaf.  Eat that bashful beaver and sit back to let the heartburn take control.
author: Jeff B.

description: I love nachos more than anything in this world. I have my favorite places to get nachos but decided to try this place as it was close to my apartment. The nachos were decent. They'd be better if the chips were homemade. What really sold me on this place was the day I decided to get a burrito. I got the super burrito with carnitas. I got to wash it down with a Mexican Coke and all was right with the world again. I've been tempted to try their other offerings but every time I go back the carnitas seduce me once again.
author: Fabian G.

description: Well, my days of eating at Taqueria El Sol went out with a bang: the microwave they used to cook my $11 enchiladas broke. (Yes, cook. Not reheat.) We go here for work all the time and I've finally had it with this place.  Consistently lukewarm food and the only flavor is salt. The place is clean, but by any other measure, not good.
author: Brian M.

description: i thought this place was pretty good until today.  usually i get a (spicy) chicken quesadilla and it's always been surprisingly good.  the service was pretty friendly as well even though it seems like they have been starting to nickle and dime you for anything and everything.  typically chips come with anything you order.  however today i was just told that they now charge 25 cents for chips.. that's still pretty cheap but it's just sad.  the service was full of impatience even though there was no one in there waiting and i told them exactly what i wanted without hesitation.  i got a super chicken burrito this time and the "super" part was a quarter size cream and guacamole drop of which the woman proceeded to smoosh around to spread it out.  again, there was NO other customers so i was wondering why they were being so incredibly stingy... when only a few months ago they weren't.  their food is pretty good and i would go back again seeing as how it's the only decent place of it's kind in the area that i've found.  still, the skimping and waning customer service has my visits down for sure.
author: Nix B.

description: Yeah you might get hit by cars when crossing the street.  Yeah crackheads might try to mess with you.  But yeah...this place is worth it, especially when it comes to the super chicken burrito.  Nothing fancy, but very well put together in terms of everything you're looking for in a burrito to make you fat again right after you get out of the gym.  Delicious.
author: Benson J.

description: this is for sure one of my favorite places to get a burrito. they're always super cool and friendly. the only downside is that it can only seat about four people without getting crowded. i don't care that it's in the tl and the're a 90% chance a crackhead is going to be standing outside. i just want a place to sit while i scarf down this yummy burrito.
author: karen w.

description: i'm a fan of the nachos, not the burritos or taco's.  when i come im, i want nachos.  besides, they always hook me up with more meat after i tip them.  :)
author: Pickle R.

description: best breakfast burrito i've ever eaten. what put it over the edge was the care and technique put into rolling the burrito. the ingredients were evenly mixed, dispersed, and  the tinfoil was tight to keep the whole thing together so there wasn't any mess. it may seem like a weird thing to be so impressed by, but i hate messy burritos, and i'd never seen one like it before.
author: shawn p.

description: I just have to say that I eat here because it's right across the street from my apt.  It's convenient, quick, and just a hair over what I consider to be edible.  As Yoda would say.. over-priced and underwhelming, the food is.
author: John C.

description: We love their regular and super burritos. The guy with the moustache and who seems to manage the Taqueria makes the best burritos. He constantly monitors the meats and mixes them. He packs those burritos as much as he can and he does so with care. There was a weird lady who worked behind the counter made the worst burritos. Every time she made it both ends of the burrito burst out in a mess and she tries to roll it again and again.  Horrible.  We are regulars and when she started working there we didn't go back for 6 months. Thank goodness we haven't seen her lately.
author: Seymour S.

description: im feelin their burrito. i got a black bean and chicken with the green sauce. the chicken was plump and delicious. the prices were a bit high. over 6 dollars for a burrito is not ok in my book. their chips and salsa was nothing special. i got a nice glass of cool water to chill my taste buds and hydrate myself while i ate the burrito.
author: Wats C.
